judges: Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Cohen,
This is an action in equity praying for specific performance of a contract for the sale of real estate. The lower court, by its decree, required defendants to perform by executing and delivering a general warranty deed conveying the property to the plaintiffs.
We affirm the decree and return the record to the lower court so that it may take the steps necessary to enforce its decree, or any amended decree that it might enter in order to effectuate its determination.
Decree affirmed at appellants’ cost.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Cohen,

attorneys: Thomas B. Geraso, with him Scales é Shaw, for appellants.
Samuel M. Rosensweig, with him David W. Gook, and Rosenmweig and Rosensweig, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
McGinnis v. Zakour, Appellant.
Argued March 20, 1967.
Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Thomas B. Geraso, with him Scales é Shaw, for appellants.
Samuel M. Rosensweig, with him David W. Gook, and Rosenmweig and Rosensweig, for appellee.
April 18, 1967:
